intro: Oxalis enneaphylla subsp. ibarii, commonly known as the Ibaria oxalis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different leaf shape and floral structure compared to other members of the species.
